alert.note: Alert for Bienville; Bossier; Claiborne; Webster (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 03 at 12:12AM CST until March 03 at 1:15AM CST by NWS Shreveport
info.description: The National Weather Service in Shreveport has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Western Union County in south central Arkansas... Southeastern Columbia County in southwestern Arkansas... Webster Parish in northwestern Louisiana... Claiborne Parish in northwestern Louisiana... North central Bienville Parish in northwestern Louisiana... East central Bossier Parish in northwestern Louisiana... * Until 115 AM CST. * At 1212 AM CST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near McNeil to near Cotton Valley to 7 miles southwest of Haughton, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Bossier City, El Dorado, Minden, Magnolia, Homer, Smackover, Norphlet, McNeil, Haughton, Arcadia, Haynesville, Sibley, Cotton Valley, Gibsland, Doyline, Emerson, Dixie Inn, Dubberly, Heflin and Shongaloo. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 AM CST for south central and southwestern Arkansas...and northwestern Louisiana. Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into the basement or small central room in a sturdy structure.
